messages.content: ComfyUI ProPost is a set of custom ComfyUI nodes for performing basic post-processing effects to make AI-generated images feel more natural.
How can ComfyUI ProPost be installed?

ComfyUI ProPost can be installed using the ComfyUI Manager by searching for 'propost' and clicking install, or manually by cloning the repository into the /ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ folder and running 'pip install -r requirements.txt'.
What is the Film Grain node in ComfyUI ProPost?

The Film Grain node in ComfyUI ProPost is a film grain effect with many parameters to control the look of the grain, capable of creating different noise types and patterns to simulate various film grain appearances.
What is the Vignette node in ComfyUI ProPost?
The Vignette node in ComfyUI ProPost is a simple vignette effect that darkens the edges of the screen, supporting subtle to more pronounced vignettes.
What is the Radial Blur node in ComfyUI ProPost?
The Radial Blur node in ComfyUI ProPost is a filter that allows blurring the edges of an image with options to create a variety of effects, including dreamy looks.
How does the Depth Map Blur node in ComfyUI ProPost work?
The Depth Map Blur node in ComfyUI ProPost allows blurring an image based on a depth map, which can be used in combination with existing Depth Map nodes like 'Depth Anything' or 'MiDaS'.
What does the Apply LUT node in ComfyUI ProPost do?
The Apply LUT node in ComfyUI ProPost allows applying a 3D LUT to an image, currently supporting only 3D LUTs in the CUBE format.
Can the effects in ComfyUI ProPost be combined?
Yes, due to the nature of ComfyUI, the effects in ComfyUI ProPost can be composed together to create more controlled and striking images.
